channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who will Trump’s trade war hit next? Fears of a ‘tariff cascade’ threaten global trade as U.S. allies gripe about ‘economic self-harm’
item.description: Governments around the world are wondering what else is coming—and which country might get hit with a White House tariff broadside.

item.title: Europe Retaliates Against Trump’s Tariffs as Trade Fight Widens
item.description: The European Union responded to American steel and aluminum tariffs with its own tariffs on boats and bourbon — and pledges of more to come.

item.title: Syria Violence Marked by Sectarian and Revenge Killings, War Monitor Says
item.description: The Syrian Network for Human Rights said armed groups and foreign fighters aligned with the government but not integrated into it were largely respons...

item.title: German Arms Maker Rheinmetall Has Record Sales in ‘Era of Rearmament’
item.description: Since the start of the war in Ukraine, the company moved quickly to meet Europe’s growing need for military spending.

item.title: The 42-mile ‘Dune Express’—America’s longest conveyor belt—moves fracking sand in Texas
item.description: It's longer than the width of Rhode Island, snakes across the oil fields of the southwest U.S. and crawls at 10 mph – too slow for a truck and too lon...

item.title: Vandalize Tesla property and the White House will prosecute you as a domestic terrorist, Trump pledges
item.description: The White House could bring the full force of the U.S. government to bear on anti-Elon Musk protestors found to have destroyed his carmaker's assets.

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum Take Effect
item.description: President Trump imposed a 25 percent tariff on metal imports. The move is expected to raise costs for U.S. manufacturers of cars, solar panels and oth...

item.title: In Trump’s Shadow, Greenland Votes for a New Government
item.description: President Trump has expressed a desire to “get” Greenland, but the victorious party is in no rush to change the status quo.

item.title: Republican Refers to Sarah McBride, Transgender Congress Member, as a Man
item.description: Representative Keith Self of Texas insisted on calling Representative Sarah McBride, the first openly transgender member of Congress, “Mr. McBride,” a...

item.description: The Syrian Network for Human Rights said armed groups and foreign fighters aligned with the government but not integrated into it were largely respons...

item.title: In Trump’s Shadow, Greenland Votes for a New Government
item.description: President Trump has expressed a desire to “get” Greenland, but the victorious party is in no rush to change the status quo.

item.title: Exclusive: Peer-to-peer clothing rental marketplace Pickle raises $12 million to become the Airbnb of fashion
item.description: Influencers and others turn to the service as a way to monetize their closets.

item.title: Europe Retaliates Against Trump’s Tariffs as Trade Fight Widens
item.description: The European Union responded to American steel and aluminum tariffs with its own tariffs on boats and bourbon — and pledges of more to come.

item.title: Companies that want to hire workers with AI skills need to focus on this 3-part strategy
item.description: Workers with AI skills are in high demand and companies are struggling to source talent.

item.title: Kurdish Fighters Called a Truce, but Turkey Kept Up Lethal Strikes
item.description: Turkey is still bombing armed Kurdish insurgents in Iraq and Syria, even after their leader urged them to lay down their arms and disband, and their g...
